alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Lake County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 23 at 9:55PM PST until December 24 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST FRIDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM FRIDAY TO 10 AM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory tonight, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the second Winter Weather Advisory Friday into Saturday morning, snow accumulations of 3 to 9 inches expected. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...For the Winter Weather Advisory tonight, this includes portions of Highway 140 near Lakeview and Highway 395 near Valley Falls. For the Winter Weather Advisory Friday into Saturday morning, this includes most all areas in central and eastern Lake Counties including Highway 140, 395 and 31 as well as Valley Falls, Lakeview, Summer Lake and surrounding communities. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory tonight, until 4 AM PST Friday. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 AM Friday to 10 AM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
